codeChecker.automaticResizeMeans: Failure means the art is not responsive to screen size changes. In order to fix need to use resizeCanvas like this:
codeChecker.confidentialCode: Rest assured, your code remains confidential with us. It is solely used for internal evaluation purposes and will not be distributed, shared, or sold in any form.
codeChecker.consistentArtMeans: Same hash produced different images. To Resolve this issue, you need to make sure that the same hash produces the same image.
codeChecker.correctHTMLNameMeans: An issue in this category means that the html should have a title tag and the title should be different from kodaHash. Like this:
codeChecker.description: Effortlessly validate your generative art code. Drop your file, check for essentials, and optimize. Preview, iterate, and finalize with confidence. Start now.
codeChecker.kodaHashCalledOnceMeans: Kodahash Render is being called multiple times, check for infinite loops.
codeChecker.learnAboutGenArt: Learn About Generative Art On Koda
codeChecker.notUsingExternalResourcesMeans: Please do not use external resouces, download each file and link it direclty.
codeChecker.title: Code Checker
codeChecker.uploadInstructions: Drop your code file here or click to select, and initiate the automated review.
codeChecker.usingKodaHashMeans: Once the rendering of art is done, a message needs to be sent signaling the end of the render. This message is necessary for art to work properly on Koda. More details can be found in the {link}. This message should look like this:
codeChecker.usingParamHash: Param Hash From Url For Rendering
codeChecker.usingParamHashMeans: Your artwork is expected to use hash url param. Like this:
codeChecker.validImage: Valid Image Sent to Kodahash Render
codeChecker.validImageMeans: Payload Send to kodahash render is empty or the image field is null. In Order to resolve this issue, you need to make sure that the image field is not null.
codeChecker.variationLoadingTimeMeans1: The time between the start of render and message kodahash/render/completed is measured. As we mentioned in the documentation, art should be quick, to make the experience for the user better. Loading time check could fail if:
codeChecker.variationLoadingTimeMeans2: Artwork is not rendered in the checker.
codeChecker.variationLoadingTimeMeans3: Takes too long to render, no clear way to fix that, the artist needs to find a way to cut down time.

first NFT market explorer on Kusama and: first NFT market explorer on Kusama and Polkadot

1.heading: Did you know...
1.question: that back in 2015 there was the first official NFT called Etheria on Ethereum?

2.heading: Did you know...
2.question: that the first 'NFT-like' standard on Kusama is literally just byte strings?

3.heading: Did you know...
3.question: that Koda has started as a rewrite of React-based DotApps dashboard into Vuejs?

4.heading: Did you know...
4.question: that Koda is building an experimental NFT landscape called MetaPrime?

5.heading: Did you know...
5.question: that there is so much psychedelic and trippy NFT artwork? We do not know either.

6.heading: Can you guess...
6.question: how many parachains Koda does support? Get the exact answer on our Discord!

7.heading: Can you guess...
7.question: how many GitHub forks the Koda repository has?

8.heading: Can you guess...
8.question: how many GitHub stars the Koda repository has?

9.heading: Do you think ...
9.question: Koda should launch its own $koda token?

10.heading: Can you guess...
10.question: how many NFTs Koda is indexing from all parachains?

11.heading: Did you know...
11.question: that Koda has a mobile app?

12.heading: Did you know...
12.question: that Koda was among the first NFT galleries supporting augmented reality for 3D objects, back in early January 2021?

13.heading: Did you know...
13.question: that Koda had fuckups during its early days? Yeah, all startups go through failures to learn from mistakes. That's how we knew that our product is getting better.

14.heading: Did you know...
14.question: that Koda has its core values and ethos being distributed, decentralized and community-owned? Try participating in our ever-growing community!

15.heading: Did you know...
15.question: that Koda has replaced three of its logos in one month?

16.heading: Did you know...
16.question: that Koda's community translations was greatest growth hack for building community to participate?

17.heading: Did you know...
17.question: that Koda had 420 Discord members on their investors pitch deck? What a coincidence.

18.heading: Did you know...
18.question: that Koda's founders encourage forking its codebase and welcome more Koda instances in the wild?

19.heading: Did you know...
19.question: that one of Koda's founders was running an infrastructure for eSports back in 2006?

20.heading: Did you know...
20.question: that these facts don't even matter? We just love to spend time with you till your action is finalized into Blockchain.

21.heading: Don't forget to...
21.question: drink enough water to stay hydrated!

22.heading: Did you know...
22.question: that we've more than 500 opened issues in our backlog on GitHub?

23.heading: Did you know...
23.question: that Koda promotes an inclusive culture to be welcoming for a wide spectrum of artists that contribute to its growth?

24.heading: Did you know...
24.question: that if you make a pull request on Koda's repository, your fun fact can be shown here?

27.heading: Did you know...
27.question: that the first version of Koda looked worse than Craiglist in 1999?

28.heading: Did you know...
28.question: that Koda's founders won a few Ethereum and Polkadot hackathons in the past?

29.heading: Did you know...
29.question: that Koda had to lay off few dozens investors interested in backing us?

30.heading: Did you know...
30.question: that Koda cares about Climate change by planting trees in Portugal, called KodaForest?

31.heading: Did you know...
31.question: that the founders of Koda believe in simulated reality?

33.heading: Did you know...
33.question: that people from all over the world contribute to our codebase?

34.heading: Did you know...
34.question: Koda has offset 10,000 kilograms of CO2, which is equivalent to 2,500 cheeseburgers.

35.heading: Did you know...
35.question: that you can get an overview of all available shortcuts by pressing '?'

36.question: Koda has added support for Asset Hub NFT marketplace recently?

37.question: Koda will be adding atomic swaps for Asset Hub NFT marketplace?

38.question: Koda Guild Rewards has distributed over $180k in bounties to contributors for their activity?

39.question: you can get paid for contributing to Koda?

40.question: Koda has over 70+ contributors to the codebase? You can fact-check this on Koda Github.

41.question: Koda Github repository has crossed 200 forks?

42.question: contributors to Koda already made more than 1500 pull requests? You can create one too!

43.question: you can be a member of the QA guild to help us with the quality of Koda releases and get paid?

44.question: you can be a member of Koda Ambassadors program and help us with various tasks?

45.question: you can be a member of the code review guild to help us with the code quality of Koda and get paid?

46.question: Koda is doing a bi-weekly recap called Meta Hours on Koda progress?

47.question: Koda team is working to support MoonRiver and MoonBeam ?

48.question: Koda team is working to support Astar and Shiden?

49.question: Koda was the first unofficial Kusama explorer? We hack fast.

50.question: Koda team is creating their own NFT protocol called Reactive NFTs? You can find a recording of the presentation on Youtube.

51.question: contributed to Koda discord discussions already?

52.question: which parachain Koda will support next?

53.question: how many guilds Koda has to keep the current pace of development?

54.question: when Koda Github repository will cross 1k stars?

55.question: Koda has produced most favourite open-source in Polkadot after Parity, MoonBeam, Acala and Astar?

56.question: Koda is becoming ultimate public good of Polkadot?

57.question: Koda team thought about making own parachain? wyt?

58.question: Koda had all-time-high 270 pull-requests in February 2022?

59.question: Koda have HQ in Slovenia, Europe?

60.question: you can help Koda resolve few issues and get paid?

61.question: you can help Koda report bugs and get paid?

62.question: Koda had all-time-high 20 contributors in one month? Will you help us to set a new record?

63.question: Koda contributors are doing payout by themselves from Koda Guild Rewards?

massmint.name: Name

0.content:
Start your mass minting by compressing all your art files into a **.ZIP for upload**. Aside from your artwork, each NFT requires a name, description, and price. 

To streamline the process, prepare these details in advance in a separate file. This avoids manually entering information for each NFT. Further guidance on formatting this file will follow in the next step.
0.title: Prepare all your files

1.instructions: Please ensure that the file field corresponds to the image file name (e.g., set "file": img1.jpg in the file field if the image has a file name of "img1.jpg").
1.subtitle: Instructions
1.title: How to Name your NFTs

2.content:
In order to use the Mass Mint feature you need to have an NFT **collection created** to which you will mint all of your NFTs. If you do not have a collection created yet, you can create one in Mass Mint.

Don't have a collection? [Create One](/create/collection)
2.title: You need to have A collection

massmint.reallyProcceed: Do You Really Want To Proceed?
massmint.uploadzipTip: Compress your Art files into a .ZIP file.

migrate.agreement: I understand this action is irreversible once done.

congrats.notes: You have successfully transferred your '{0}' from the {1} network over to the {2}.
congrats.subtitle: Your migration is complete.
congrats.title: Congratulations!

migrate.connect: To view and migrate assets, please connect your wallet.

faq1.desc: Migration is the process of safely transferring your NFTs/collection from Kusama to Polkadot/kusama Asset Hub along with all their embedded information such as ownership records and transaction history. This ensures your NFTs maintain their value and authenticity on the new platform. Importantly, once completed, this action is irreversible.
faq1.title: What is Migration?

faq2.desc:
With our tool, migrating your NFTs to Polkadot/kusama Asset Hub is just a few steps away.


  1. Select your collection or items
  2. Review all details in the overview.
  3. Initiate the migration process.
  4. Sign all required transactions.
faq2.title: How to Migrate?

faq3.desc:
The cost depends on:

  • Destination blockchain - Fees differ between Polkadot Asset Hub and Kusama Asset Hub.
  • Number of items - Migrating more NFTs incurs higher overall costs.

An estimate specific to your migration is provided on the overview page before signing
faq3.title: What Are The Costs?

faq4.desc:
For a detailed look at our migration process, check out our help article on initiating and completing NFT transfers. This guide covers requirements, fees, and more.


See Article ->
faq4.title: Learn More About Process

migrate.heading: Migrate Your Art

modal.subtitle: Any progress here will be lost.
modal.title: Are you sure you want to leave?

ready.desc: As the creator or owner of a collection, you can initiate migration here. Keep in mind, only items owned by you can be migrated at this stage. You'll need to pre-sign items owned by others to allow individual migrations.
ready.title: Ready For Migration

migrate.reviewNotes: Please note that at this stage, only items you own can be migrated.
migrate.signNotes: Based on your item count, you may need to sign multiple transactions for the migration. Please stay on this page until all signatures fully process to lock in the migration.

signStep.authorize: Please authorize transactions to complete the NFT migration.
signStep.journey: Launching your journey with a first transaction that sets up everything needed on the new chain.
signStep.notesModal: - Please do not exit this modal until transactions are complete -
signStep.notesPopup: Look for popups from your wallet extension for signing.
signStep.signtx: You will now sign transactions to migrate NFTs you own.

migrate.subHeading: Welcome to our migration page. Here, we've simplified moving your NFTs from Kusama to the Polkadot Asset Hub, making the process quick, easy and efficient.
migrate.tooltipCollectionLabel: Can't find your collection in the list? Make sure you're connected to the correct account/address that owns the collection.

waiting.desc: Displayed here are individual items that you own from collections that have been migrated. Ensure you're up-to-date by migrating these pieces right away. Please note, you can only start the migration once the collection owner initiates it.
waiting.title: Waiting For Your Action

walletConnect.authText: Koda will never ask you to provide your mnemonic phrase or private key.

walletConnect.startConnect: Start trading NFTs by connecting a digital wallet.

warning.newTransactionWhilePriceSet: Setting the price now requires making an additional transaction.

cta.description: Elevate your art on Koda. Join a community where your creativity thrives, your voice is heard, and your art is celebrated. Start your journey, grow with us, and let every code on our platform mark the beginning of something extraordinary.
cta.heading: Take the Next Step

community.description: We're not just about art; we're about fostering a community where quality and creativity shine bright. Bringing together collectors, artists and enthusiasts brings us joy and open doors for new opportunities.
community.name: Community

earnRewards.description: Participate in our competitions, try commission work, collect rewards by referring artists, or become part of the team. There are so many opportunities that are waiting for you.
earnRewards.name: Earn Rewards

generativeArt.description: Our heart beats for generative art, where code meets canvas, crafting the extraordinary out of the ordinary. It's not just art; it's an experience, a journey through creativity powered by the elegance of algorithms
generativeArt.name: Generative Art

koda.description: Koda means code in the Slovenian language. Which is now our primary focus. To deliver not only high-quality generative art but also to grow our code base, add new features and expand our horizons not only in the Polkadot ecosystem but also outside of it.
koda.name: Koda

offlineExhibitions.description: Organized to connect people with the same passion - art. During these events, we focus on promoting digital art, enlightening people about its significance and the technology behind it, building connections, and enjoying amazing art. Always happening in a big cities that love art like Berlin, Prague, Lisbon, Budapest and many more.
offlineExhibitions.name: Offline Exhibitions

onboarding.description: Simple onboarding is key to ensuring that artists are able to start selling their art. Their first steps on the platform are the most important. In the next steps, we introduce them to our community, provide them with support in case they need it, and listen to their ideas. In the end, it's the artists who always have amazing ideas about features we can bring.
onboarding.name: Onboarding

team.description: In the heart of the Koda, we have a dedicated team. Our passion drives us, and we are strongly focused on onboarding quality art with quick problem-solving solutions.
team.name: Team

weeklyDrops.description: We offer brand new weekly drops that are limited, created by various talented artists. At this point we did more than 18 drops from various talented artists from around the globe.
weeklyDrops.name: Weekly Drops
